pages.text: Since the $(l:resources/jade_vines)Jade Vines$() are notorious for restorative properties, it's no wonder they translate perfectly when fermented.$(br)In contrast to the slight bitterness of the bulbs, adding a good share of petals brings out a more bloomy and slightly sour taste instead, complimented with earthy undertones - almost resembling wine, in trademark jade color.

pages.title: Titration Recipe
pages.text: $(item)1 Bulb$() and $(item)3 Petals$() for the $(item)Bucket of Water$() feel like a good starting point.$(br)The longer the fermentation goes on, the stronger the taste gets. $(br2)$(italic)A bit of $(item)added sweetness$() would do it good, you are sure.

pages.title: Sweetening
pages.text: Adding a drop of $(item)Moonstruck Nectar$() seems to make the Wine much easier to drink. The fermentation process is increased and negative effects are noticeably softened.

Your newest result of fermenting Jade Wine was a $(italic)tad$() too long.$(br)Immensely bitter and slightly acidic taste.$(br)While it retains some of the properties of the Jade Wine it once resembled, seems more useful for medicine than for drinking.$(br)But, you know... is anyone stopping you?
